intro: Triumfetta brachypetala, commonly known as the short-petalled triumfetta, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its small, white or pale pink flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and the leaves are ovate with a hairy surface. The plant is characterized by its fibrous roots and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides.
